name: src/bin.js
src/index.js
withArgs
description: Creates a new ESDocCoverage instance with the given command line arguments.

params.name: args
params.description: The command line arguments to use.

name: constructor
description: Creates a new ESDocCoverage instance based on some options and the command to run.

params.name: command
params.description:
The command to run. Note that you have to call ESDocCoverage#run to
run the command specified.

name: options
description: The options the current instance was created with.

name: _getESDocConfig
description: Searches the given paths for valid ESDoc configurations.

return.description:
Fulfilled with the ESDoc config found or rejected with the
error that occured.

name: _getCoverageReport
description: Gets the documentation coverage report for the given config.

return.description:
Fulfilled with the coverage report found or rejected with the
error that occured.

name: _checkCoverageReport
description:
Validates the documentation coverage reported in the given report matches the threshold
specified.

params.name: command
params.description:
The command to run. If not provided it is assumed, that a command
was passed to the constructor.

return.description: A promise that is rejected if the command fails.

name: src/lib/CliReporter.js
CliReporter
description: A reporter that prints an ASCII table with all files and their coverage values.

name: addRow
description: Adds a row to the table

params.name: success
params.description: If the file's documentation coverage meets the threshold.

params.name: uncoveredLines
params.description: Array of line numbers not documented.

name: report
description: Reports the coverage of a file.

params.name: success
params.description: If the file's documentation coverage meets the threshold.

params.name: uncoveredLines
params.description: Array of line numbers not documented.

name: finish
description:
Adds a summary row to the table and prints it. Also sets the process exit code to `1` if the
threshold was not met.

return.description: Resolved with the report or an error.

name: src/lib/JUnitReporter.js
JUnitReporter
description: A reporter that creates JUnit-style XML reports.

name: report
description: Reports the coverage of a file.

params.name: success
params.description: If the file's documentation coverage meets the threshold.

params.name: uncoveredLines
params.description: Array of line numbers not documented.

name: finish
description: Creates and prints the XML reports.

return.description: Resolved with the report or an error.

name: src/lib/Reporter.js
success
description: If the report has a failure.

name: notCoveredFiles
description: The number of files processed but nut covered.

name: report
description: Reports the coverage of a file.

params.name: success
params.description: If the file's documentation coverage meets the threshold.

params.name: uncoveredLines
params.description: Array of line numbers not documented.

name: finish
description: Called once all files have been processed. Outputs the report.

return.description: Resolved with the report or an error.

content:
# esdoc-coverage

> Check [ESDoc](https://esdoc.org) coverage

[![CircleCI](https://circleci.com/gh/ls-age/esdoc-coverage.svg?style=shield)](https://circleci.com/gh/ls-age/esdoc-coverage)
[![codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/ls-age/esdoc-coverage/branch/master/graph/badge.svg)](https://codecov.io/gh/ls-age/esdoc-coverage)
[![ESDoc](https://doc.esdoc.org/github.com/ls-age/esdoc-coverage/badge.svg)](https://doc.esdoc.org/github.com/ls-age/esdoc-coverage/)

**Please note that this module is still in early development.**

## Installation

> Requires node.js (version >= 6) to be installed

Run `npm install --save-dev @ls-age/esdoc-coverage` to install the package
 
## Usage

After running `esdoc` run `esdoc-coverage` with the same arguments.

For all available option run `esdoc-coverage --help`

content: # Change Log All notable changes to this project will be documented in this file. See [standard-version](https://github.com/conventional-changelog/standard-version) for commit guidelines. ## [0.1.3](https://github.com/ls-age/esdoc-coverage/compare/v0.1.2...v0.1.3) (2017-10-24) ### Bug Fixes * Use threshold given through options ([dad5055](https://github.com/ls-age/esdoc-coverage/commit/dad5055)) ## [0.1.2](https://github.com/ls-age/esdoc-coverage/compare/v0.1.1...v0.1.2) (2017-04-09) ### Bug Fixes * **release:** Add build files to npm releases ([5fa48b2](https://github.com/ls-age/esdoc-coverage/commit/5fa48b2)) ## [0.1.1](https://github.com/ls-age/esdoc-coverage/compare/v0.1.0...v0.1.1) (2017-04-09) ### Bug Fixes * **package:** Replace invalid bin path ([0847187](https://github.com/ls-age/esdoc-coverage/commit/0847187)) # 0.1.0 (2017-04-09) ### Bug Fixes * Print percentage value ([facb46c](https://github.com/ls-age/esdoc-coverage/commit/facb46c)) ### Features * **JUnitReporter:** Better error messages ([066d6ce](https://github.com/ls-age/esdoc-coverage/commit/066d6ce))
